channel.title: How to make it http://www, not http://?
channel.description:
Yes, well, I found out there are different sessions for http://SITE, and http://www.SITE.
So how would I fix this? Please help ^_^

item.title: How to make it http://www, not http://?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

The www indicates that you will be typing in a domain name after it, so that interprets it differently. If you try and say, type in a webservers IP with a preceding www, it wont work, unless that IP is a registered domain.

One thing you can do, it make it read the session that it reads, and if it’s not the one you want, you can have it redirect to one with the WWW or without.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make it http://www, not http://?

item.title: How to make it http://www, not http://?
item.dc:creator: @EwfsPrince EwfsPrince
item.description:
@EwfsPrince wrote:

Easiest solution is make sure the SSL content is coming from the same domain eg: sslstuff.mydomain.com and use php redirect and hyperlink your site so it leaves out the www. (or keeps it in). You weren’t specific with your problem so I can’t really help but that ^ is probably the easiest solution. Some other problems might be how your server is configured or you may of set up your SSL incorrectly in the SSL setup when you purchased the certificate.

The most likely problem is that your site source doesn’t know how to interpret URL requests that switches from ‘www’ to domain based URL.
Maybe elaborate on your problem a little more and I might be able to help.

Cheers

Read full topic
item.source: How to make it http://www, not http://?
